Nestled on East 2nd Street between Second Avenue and the Bowery, this beautifully renovated one-bedroom cooperative blends timeless pre-war charm with modern comfort in one of Manhattan’s most dynamic neighborhoods.

Bathed in light through oversized windows, the apartment boasts soaring ceilings that enhance its sense of space and airiness. Carefully updated, the home retains a classic New York aesthetic while offering contemporary convenience — all with an incredibly low monthly maintenance of just $400.82. Granite countertops, high end appliances (refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, stove and air conditioner) are all included. A Turn Key sale including all furnishings can be arranged.

Located in the East Village/Lower East Side Historic District, 32 East 2nd Street is a well-maintained, intimate walk-up cooperative. The building welcomes pets, allows gifting and co-purchasing, and encourages engaged ownership.  Some apartments in the building feature washer/dryers. 

Outside your door, discover an unbeatable downtown lifestyle. Surrounded by some of the best restaurants, nightlife, and cultural institutions in the city, you’re just moments from Whole Foods, SoHo, Bond Street, and beloved local favorites like The Wren, Gemma, and The Bowery Hotel. The F and 6 trains are just two blocks away, offering quick access to the rest of the city.
